paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 presented with neuropathy at age 30 and was diagnosed with TTR amyloidosis at age 32.
Patient P2 was diagnosed with TTR amyloidosis at age 42 after experiencing cardiac symptoms starting at age 40.
Patient P3, aged 50, is a carrier but remains asymptomatic.

functional_data.summary: The V40M variant leads to misfolding of the TTR protein, contributing to amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, observed in multiple affected relatives.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the importance of early diagnosis and monitoring in carriers.
key_quotes: The V40M variant is associated with a significant risk of developing TTR amyloidosis.
Penetrance varies significantly with age, particularly in the 50-70 age group.

tables_processed.table_caption: Variants in the TTR gene associated with amyloidosis

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
